author: Jim Cook
comment: Viewranger is an incredibly versatile and useful app.  I always use it when walking or cycling.  I recently had a problem  when the app wouldn't open, so I contacted viewranger support and received  fantastic help from a chap named Mike, who soon had me up and running again.  Altogether brilliant!

author: Dave Burk
comment: I have used this app for several years and it has made my walks, runs and cycling so much more enjoyable. It never lets me down and reduces the stress of navigating considerably. The after sales support is faultless. If only all apps\companies were as good!

It doesn't tell you that it needs certain things on your device for skyline to work, and it doesn't let you know if there is anything you can do to add it. Also, none of my local trails were included, and I live near county Park and national monuments.

reply.author: Augmentra
reply.content: Skyline needs the phone to have a compass, gyro and accelerometer. These are physical sensors built in to the phone, not something that can be added. Your phone doesn't have a compass or gyro, so can't use Skyline.

author: steve n
comment: This is the best adventure enabling and adventure tracking app! I love how your profile syncs with their servers. It enables you to easily plan routes on the pc then sync to your phone to use out. Doesn't need service to track via gps. Never had any issues. Highly recommend it! But wish it were more known and social!  Also wish there was a way to see all tracks I've recorded on the website on the PC! Asking too much? Maybe but you guys can develop that 😉

author: Ryan McGowan
comment: Can import and export gpx so no vendor lock in. As a result this app provides pretty great maps and features.

author: Marcus Clark
comment: Great for recording routes and as a navigational back up, plus I find it extremely helpful when planning routes. Thumbs up.

author: Maurice Crouch
comment: Use this app a lot never get lost.
Simply the must-have app for outdoor adventurers.

author: David Ryan
comment: Doesnt work without data went to national park 40 ks away from town out in bush no towers just trees scrub  dust dirt and water 4x4 didnt work tryed but couldnt get it to work no gain or lose looks good but would of been happy if it worked update ok saved map works cheers

reply.author: Augmentra
reply.content:
Save a map before you go out, then it will have the map and other data available when there is no signal. 
To save a map, first drag or search, and use pinch zoom to get the general area you need on screen. Use Map Layers, the button with 2 squares top right, 'Save for Offline Use". Adjust the area, then tap download.

author: Frank Mann
comment: Great free app. Best I've tried so far.

author: Dougie Begg
comment: Great app for hill walking

author: Ian Berkley
comment: Great app and customer service!

author: Luke I
comment: Not many routes at all.

author: stephen dawes
comment: Life saver for work

author: Steve Erdody
comment: Works great

author: Daniel Nolan
comment: Great

author: Carol
comment: This app is amazing. The support is second to none.  I ride alone sometimes and its nice to have the buddy beacon for reasurance. I plan routes and go off exploring, its opened up so much for me.

Great app. Downloads available free as well as paid, by way of credits. Certainly gets you to some off the beaten track places. Good for Walking, hiking, mountain biking. In this day and age of fitness apps a link to the likes of fitbit etc. has to be the next obvious upgrade

author: Tom Barnes
comment: Great app, I just turn it on and head off for a run. No need to plan, just go where I feel like and I always know where I am and how to get back. And I know how I performed. Spot on

author: Ron Winchester
comment: No good if you can't find the trail. This app doesn't provide directions to the trail. Also, street names aren't shown on the maps.

reply.author: Augmentra
reply.content:
The free maps included with the app - Open Street, Cycle and Landscape - all do have street names. Switch to them using Map layers, the 2 squares top right. 
The app is really focused on off road use, but I've added providing directions to the the trail head to our wish list, thank you for your feedback!

author: Loraine Simpson
comment: This is a great navigation app, the best I've used. Great value too. The offline feature is great too

author: Markus Jarvinen
comment: Great for hike tracking. App needs app and website could use some refinement of user interface, but functionality is solid.

author: Jim Johnston
comment: This is the best GPS App that I have used. Their customer service is superb as well, if I have had any problems, they reply very quickly

author: Charlie Ogilvie
comment: Brilliant! So useful for taking myself out into the country :)

author: Sonya Barnes
comment: Use it for recording walks in the wilds. Fascinating to see where we have been and the elevation etc

author: Mickey Mousec
comment: Confusing interface and very expensive maps.

author: Tom Lorimer
comment: Really good to see this using the GPS on my Sony smartwatch 3 and adding maps to the watch display
Brilliant I've never had a problem when hiking with this

author: Fergus McGee
comment: Fantastic navigation app.

author: Terri Redman
comment: Brilliant app

author: Jonny Welch
comment: Fantastic app use it all the time for walking and hiking

author: AJ Degtyarev
comment: I am a born Traveler & Adventurer. I love this app.

author: Paul Watts
comment: Just great

author: Adam Patrick
comment: Awesome!
excellent.

author: David Stamp
comment: Really good. Use it for walking the dog, having a map that shows all the footpaths is so useful. Found tons of walks i never knew existed.

author: Martin Free
comment: Excellent app. I don't go into the hills without it...

author: matt fletcher
comment: This is a potentially very useful app but the Swedish maps have no contours!  You can't tell what the elevation changes are so you cannot possibly plan a route with it.  I had to revert to paper maps.  Expected more considering the price of this.

reply.author: Augmentra
reply.content:
The Sweden maps are formed of 3 different styles:
Terrängkartan, with contours, for most of Sweden except Norrbotten, Västerbotten and northern part of Jämtland County.
Fjällkartan, Mountain Map with contours, for the Swedish mountains from Sälen to Treriksröset;
Vägkartan, Roadmap with no contours, for the remaining area in the north of Sweden.

comment: A great App used it on and off for years. when out with friends in the Derbyshire peaks I use it to follow us to see how far we gone. Also as a backup for paper map to make sure we are on track especially in bad weather (fog) . Handy pause button for stops of refreshments. Even better with the bigger screen of the Hudl 2 . Thanks for such a useful app.

author: APS
comment: I wish the walking paths on the map could be made bolder- currently they're very difficult to see unless you zoom right in.
